verses.kjv: And David said, Is there yet any that is left of the house of Saul, that I may shew him kindness for Jonathan’s sake?
verses.web: David said, “Is there yet any who is left of Saul’s house, that I may show him kindness for Jonathan’s sake?”
verses.ct: One day David asked, "Is there anyone still alive from Saul's family? I want to show them kindness because of my promise to Jonathan."

verses.kjv: And there was of the house of Saul a servant whose name was Ziba. And when they had called him unto David, the king said unto him, Art thou Ziba? And he said, Thy servant is he.
verses.web: There was of Saul’s house a servant whose name was Ziba, and they called him to David; and the king said to him, “Are you Ziba?” He said, “I am your servant.”
verses.ct: Now there was a servant from Saul's household named Ziba. When they brought him before David, the king asked, "Are you Ziba?" He replied, "I am, your servant."

verses.kjv: And the king said, Is there not yet any of the house of Saul, that I may shew the kindness of God unto him? And Ziba said unto the king, Jonathan hath yet a son, which is lame on his feet.
verses.web: The king said, “Is there not yet any of Saul’s house, that I may show the kindness of God to him?” Ziba said to the king, “Jonathan still has a son, who is lame in his feet.”
verses.ct: The king asked, "Is there anyone left from Saul's family that I can show God's kindness to?" Ziba answered, "Jonathan still has a son. He's crippled in both feet."

verses.kjv: And the king said unto him, Where is he? And Ziba said unto the king, Behold, he is in the house of Machir, the son of Ammiel, in Lodebar.
verses.web: The king said to him, “Where is he?” Ziba said to the king, “Behold, he is in the house of Machir the son of Ammiel, in Lo Debar.”
verses.ct: "Where is he?" the king asked. Ziba told him, "He's living in the house of Machir son of Ammiel, in Lodebar."

verses.kjv: Then king David sent, and fetched him out of the house of Machir, the son of Ammiel, from Lodebar.
verses.web: Then king David sent, and brought him out of the house of Machir the son of Ammiel, from Lo Debar.
verses.ct: So King David sent for him and had him brought from Machir son of Ammiel's house in Lodebar.

verses.kjv: Now when Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan, the son of Saul, was come unto David, he fell on his face, and did reverence. And David said, Mephibosheth. And he answered, Behold thy servant!
verses.web: Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan, the son of Saul, came to David, and fell on his face, and showed respect. David said, “Mephibosheth.” He answered, “Behold, your servant!”
verses.ct: When Mephibosheth — Jonathan's son and Saul's grandson — came before David, he fell facedown and bowed low. David said, "Mephibosheth." He answered, "I'm here — your servant."

verses.kjv: And David said unto him, Fear not: for I will surely shew thee kindness for Jonathan thy father’s sake, and will restore thee all the land of Saul thy father; and thou shalt eat bread at my table continually.
verses.web: David said to him, “Don’t be afraid; for I will surely show you kindness for Jonathan your father’s sake, and will restore to you all the land of Saul your father. You will eat bread at my table continually.”
verses.ct: David told him, "Don't be afraid. I'm going to show you kindness because of your father Jonathan. I'll give back to you all the land that belonged to your grandfather Saul, and you'll eat at my table for the rest of your life."

verses.kjv: And he bowed himself, and said, What is thy servant, that thou shouldest look upon such a dead dog as I am?
verses.web: He bowed down, and said, “What is your servant, that you should look at such a dead dog as I am?”
verses.ct: Mephibosheth bowed again and said, "Why would you pay attention to a dead dog like me? I'm nothing."

verses.kjv: Then the king called to Ziba, Saul’s servant, and said unto him, I have given unto thy master’s son all that pertained to Saul and to all his house.
verses.web: Then the king called to Ziba, Saul’s servant, and said to him, “All that belonged to Saul and to all his house I have given to your master’s son.
verses.ct: Then the king summoned Ziba, Saul's former servant, and told him, "I've given your master's grandson everything that belonged to Saul and his entire family."

verses.kjv: Thou therefore, and thy sons, and thy servants, shall till the land for him, and thou shalt bring in the fruits, that thy master’s son may have food to eat: but Mephibosheth thy master’s son shall eat bread alway at my table. Now Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty servants.
verses.web: Till the land for him, you, your sons, and your servants. Bring in the harvest, that your master’s son may have bread to eat; but Mephibosheth your master’s son will always eat bread at my table.” Now Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty servants.
verses.ct: "You, your sons, and your servants will farm the land for him and bring in the harvest so his household will have food. But Mephibosheth himself will always eat at my table." Ziba had 15 sons and 20 servants.

verses.kjv: Then said Ziba unto the king, According to all that my lord the king hath commanded his servant, so shall thy servant do. As for Mephibosheth, said the king, he shall eat at my table, as one of the king’s sons.
verses.web: Then Ziba said to the king, “According to all that my lord the king commands his servant, so your servant will do.” So Mephibosheth ate at the king’s table, like one of the king’s sons.
verses.ct: Ziba said to the king, "Your servant will do everything my lord the king commands." And so Mephibosheth ate at David's table, just like one of the king's own sons.

verses.kjv: And Mephibosheth had a young son, whose name was Micha. And all that dwelt in the house of Ziba were servants unto Mephibosheth.
verses.web: Mephibosheth had a young son, whose name was Mica. All that lived in Ziba’s house were servants to Mephibosheth.
verses.ct: Mephibosheth had a young son named Micha. Everyone who lived in Ziba's household served Mephibosheth.

verses.kjv: So Mephibosheth dwelt in Jerusalem: for he did eat continually at the king’s table; and was lame on both his feet.
verses.web: So Mephibosheth lived in Jerusalem; for he ate continually at the king’s table. He was lame in both his feet.
verses.ct: From then on, Mephibosheth lived in Jerusalem, eating regularly at the king's table. He was crippled in both feet.
